text: 1152 Market Street in 1933 Market Street Warehouse Historic District is listed on the National Register of Historic Places and was built on the location of a former American Civil War fort. Warehouse Row, Stone Fort Block 1118-1148 Market Street, is a collection of restaurants, retail shops and assorted businesses occupying the north and south buildings of a former knitting mill in Chattanooga, Tennessee.Warehouse Row ramps up: Historic retail/office center is buzzing with new energy and new tenants Times Free Press September 21, 2014 by Mike Pare ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Hamilton County, Tennessee ==References== ==External links== *Warehouse Row webpage Category:Historic districts on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Chattanooga, Tennessee Category:Warehouses on the National Register of Historic Places Category:National Register of Historic Places in Chattanooga, Tennessee
title: Market Street Warehouse Historic District
